[![Github top language](https://img.shields.io/github/languages/top/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD.svg?style=for-the-badge)](../../) [![Codacy grade](https://img.shields.io/codacy/grade/[codacy-proj-id].svg?style=for-the-badge)](https://www.codacy.com/manual/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD) [![Repository size](https://img.shields.io/github/repo-size/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD.svg?style=for-the-badge)](../../) [![Issues](https://img.shields.io/github/issues/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD.svg?style=for-the-badge)](../../issues) [![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD.svg?style=for-the-badge)](/LICENSE.md) [![Commit activity](https://img.shields.io/github/commit-activity/m/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD.svg?style=for-the-badge)](../../commits/master) [![Last commit](https://img.shields.io/github/last-commit/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD.svg?style=for-the-badge)](../../commits/master) [![PyPI](https://img.shields.io/pypi/dm/catmd.svg?style=for-the-badge)](https://pypi.org/project/catmd/) # Python.CatMD Cat markdown to the terminal - [Features](#features) - [Roadmap](#roadmap) - [Install With PIP](#install-with-pip) - [Use](#use) - [CLI](#cli) - [Import](#import) - [Language information](#language-information) - [Built for](#built-for) - [Install Python on Windows](#install-python-on-windows) - [Chocolatey](#chocolatey) - [Download](#download) - [Install Python on Linux](#install-python-on-linux) - [Apt](#apt) - [How to run](#how-to-run) - [With VSCode](#with-vscode) - [From the Terminal](#from-the-terminal) - [Changelog](#changelog) - [Download](#download-1) - [Clone](#clone) - [Using The Command Line](#using-the-command-line) - [Using GitHub Desktop](#using-github-desktop) - [Download Zip File](#download-zip-file) - [Licence](#licence) - [Screenshots](#screenshots) - [Desktop](#desktop) - [Themes](#themes) ## Features Highlights the following: - Headers 1-6 - Unordered and ordered lists - Block quotes - Bold, Italic, Strikethrough, inline code - Github check boxes - Line Break (br) Renders the following - Tables - Images (uses catimage for this so they can look a bit blurry...) Higlights code blocks - Uses pygments for code syntax highlighting ## Roadmap For completed components, see the changelog (link below) |Feature|Description|Status| |---|---|---| |mdbuf2html.py|Output to html|-| ## Install With PIP ```python pip install catmd ``` Head to https://pypi.org/project/catmd/ for more info ## Use ### CLI ```bash usage: application.py [-h] [--width WIDTH] [--theme THEME] file ``` ### Import Take a look at test/catcomplex.py for an example of how to use catmd in your own project. Or take a look at the example below ```python from catmd import md2mdbuf, mdbuf2ansi print(mdbuf2ansi.mdbuf2ansi(md2mdbuf.md2mdbuf(open(THISDIR + os.sep + "cli2gui.md", "r").read()), 130, (1, 4, 1))) ``` ## Language information ### Built for This program has been written for Python 3 and has been tested with Python version 3.8.0 . ## Install Python on Windows ### Chocolatey ```powershell choco install python ``` ### Download To install Python, go to and download the latest version. ## Install Python on Linux ### Apt ```bash sudo apt install python3.8 ``` ## How to run ### With VSCode 1. Open the .py file in vscode 2. Ensure a python 3.8 interpreter is selected (Ctrl+Shift+P > Python:Select Interpreter > Python 3.8) 3. Run by pressing Ctrl+F5 (if you are prompted to install any modules, accept) ### From the Terminal ```bash ./[file].py ``` ## Changelog See the [CHANGELOG](/CHANGELOG.md) for more information. ## Download ### Clone #### Using The Command Line 1. Press the Clone or download button in the top right 2. Copy the URL (link) 3. Open the command line and change directory to where you wish to clone to 4. Type 'git clone' followed by URL in step 2 ```bash $ git clone https://github.com/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD ``` More information can be found at #### Using GitHub Desktop 1. Press the Clone or download button in the top right 2. Click open in desktop 3. Choose the path for where you want and click Clone More information can be found at ### Download Zip File 1. Download this GitHub repository 2. Extract the zip archive 3. Copy/ move to the desired location ## Licence MIT License Copyright (c) FredHappyface (See the [LICENSE](/LICENSE.md) for more information.) ## Screenshots ### Desktop
### Themes
info.name: catmd
info.html_description:
Python.CatMD

Cat markdown to the terminal

  • Features
  • Roadmap
  • Install With PIP
  • Use
    • CLI
    • Import
  • Language information
    • Built for
  • Install Python on Windows
    • Chocolatey
    • Download
  • Install Python on Linux
    • Apt
  • How to run
    • With VSCode
    • From the Terminal
  • Changelog
  • Download
    • Clone
      • Using The Command Line
      • Using GitHub Desktop
    • Download Zip File
  • Licence
  • Screenshots
    • Desktop
    • Themes

Features

Highlights the following:

  • Headers 1-6
  • Unordered and ordered lists
  • Block quotes
  • Bold, Italic, Strikethrough, inline code
  • Github check boxes
  • Line Break (br)

Renders the following

  • Tables
  • Images (uses catimage for this so they can look a bit blurry...)

Higlights code blocks

  • Uses pygments for code syntax highlighting

Roadmap

For completed components, see the changelog (link below)

Feature Description Status
mdbuf2html.py Output to html -

Install With PIP

pip install catmd

Head to https://pypi.org/project/catmd/ for more info

Use

CLI

usage: application.py [-h] [--width WIDTH] [--theme THEME] file

Import

Take a look at test/catcomplex.py for an example of how to use catmd in your own project. Or take a look at the example below

from catmd import md2mdbuf, mdbuf2ansi
print(mdbuf2ansi.mdbuf2ansi(md2mdbuf.md2mdbuf(open(THISDIR + os.sep + "cli2gui.md", "r").read()),
 130, (1, 4, 1)))

Language information

Built for

This program has been written for Python 3 and has been tested with Python version 3.8.0 https://www.python.org/downloads/release/python-380/.

Install Python on Windows

Chocolatey

choco install python

Download

To install Python, go to https://www.python.org/ and download the latest version.

Install Python on Linux

Apt

sudo apt install python3.8

How to run

With VSCode

  1. Open the .py file in vscode
  2. Ensure a python 3.8 interpreter is selected (Ctrl+Shift+P > Python:Select Interpreter > Python 3.8)
  3. Run by pressing Ctrl+F5 (if you are prompted to install any modules, accept)

From the Terminal

./[file].py

Changelog

See the CHANGELOG for more information.

Download

Clone

Using The Command Line

  1. Press the Clone or download button in the top right
  2. Copy the URL (link)
  3. Open the command line and change directory to where you wish to clone to
  4. Type 'git clone' followed by URL in step 2
$ git clone https://github.com/FredHappyface/Python.CatMD

More information can be found at https://help.github.com/en/articles/cloning-a-repository

Using GitHub Desktop

  1. Press the Clone or download button in the top right
  2. Click open in desktop
  3. Choose the path for where you want and click Clone

More information can be found at https://help.github.com/en/desktop/contributing-to-projects/cloning-a-repository-from-github-to-github-desktop

Download Zip File

  1. Download this GitHub repository
  2. Extract the zip archive
  3. Copy/ move to the desired location

Licence

MIT License Copyright (c) FredHappyface (See the LICENSE for more information.)
